question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Three cards are dealt at random from a standard deck (13 clubs, 13 diamonds, 13 hearts, and 13 spades) of 52 cards.  What is the probability that all three cards are $\heartsuit$s?
inference:
There are $\binom{52}{3}$ ways to choose 3 cards from a standard deck of 52 cards.
There are $\binom{13}{3}$ ways to choose 3 hearts from the 13 hearts in the deck.
The probability that all three cards are hearts is
$$\frac{\binom{13}{3}}{\binom{52}{3}} = \frac{\frac{13 \times 12 \times 11}{3 \times 2 \times 1}}{\frac{52 \times 51 \times 50}{3 \times 2 \times 1}} = \frac{13 \times 12 \times 11}{3 \times 2 \times 1} \times \frac{3 \times 2 \times 1}{52 \times 51 \times 50} = \frac{13 \times 2 \times 11}{52 \times 17 \times 50} = \frac{286}{132600} = \frac{13 \times 11 \times 2}{52 \times 17 \times 25 \times 2} = \frac{13 \times 11}{52 \times 17 \times 25} = \frac{11}{52 \times 17 \times 25/13} = \frac{11}{4 \times 17 \times 25} = \frac{11}{1700} = \frac{11}{1700} = \frac{13 \times 2 \times 11}{52 \times 17 \times 25} = \frac{1}{221}.$$
$$\frac{\binom{13}{3}}{\binom{52}{3}} = \frac{\frac{13 \times 12 \times 11}{3 \times 2 \times 1}}{\frac{52 \times 51 \times 50}{3 \times 2 \times 1}} = \frac{13 \times 2 \times 11}{52 \times 17 \times 25} = \frac{286}{22100} = \frac{143}{11050} = \frac{1}{50/2} = \frac{1}{39} \frac{13 \times 2 \times 11}{52 \times 17 \times 25} = \frac{11}{17 \times 25} = \frac{11}{22100} = \frac{1}{1700} = \frac{2}{3400} = \frac{2}{286 \times 39} \times \frac{11}{4} \frac{11}{4 \times 17 \times 25} \frac{11}{17 \times 100} \frac{11}{1700}$$
$\frac{\binom{13}{3}}{\binom{52}{3}} = \frac{\frac{13 \times 12 \times 11}{3 \times 2 \times 1}}{\frac{52 \times 51 \times 50}{3 \times 2 \times 1}} = \frac{13 \times 2 \times 11}{52 \times 17 \times 25} = \frac{286}{22100} = \frac{1}{77} \frac{11}{1700}$.

$\frac{286}{22100} = \frac{143}{11050} = \frac{13\times 11}{52\times 17\times 25} = \frac{11}{17 \times 100} = \frac{1}{78} = \frac{1}{77} \frac{11}{1700}$

Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{11}{850}}$

question:
There are $\binom{52}{3}$ ways to choose 3 cards from a standard deck of 52 cards.
There are $\binom{13}{3}$ ways to choose 3 hearts from the 13 hearts in the deck.
The probability that all three cards are hearts is
$$\frac{\binom{13}{3}}{\binom{52}{3}} = \frac{\frac{13 \times 12 \times 11}{3 \times 2 \times 1}}{\frac{52 \times 51 \times 50}{3 \times 2 \times 1}} = \frac{13 \times 12 \times 11}{3 \times 2 \times 1} \times \frac{3 \times 2 \times 1}{52 \times 51 \times 50} = \frac{13 \times 2 \times 11}{52 \times 17 \times 50} = \frac{286}{132600} = \frac{13 \times 11 \times 2}{52 \times 17 \times 25 \times 2} = \frac{13 \times 11}{52 \times 17 \times 25} = \frac{11}{52 \times 17 \times 25/13} = \frac{11}{4 \times 17 \times 25} = \frac{11}{1700} = \frac{11}{1700} = \frac{13 \times 2 \times 11}{52 \times 17 \times 25} = \frac{1}{221}.$$
$$\frac{\binom{13}{3}}{\binom{52}{3}} = \frac{\frac{13 \times 12 \times 11}{3 \times 2 \times 1}}{\frac{52 \times 51 \times 50}{3 \times 2 \times 1}} = \frac{13 \times 2 \times 11}{52 \times 17 \times 25} = \frac{286}{22100} = \frac{143}{11050} = \frac{1}{50/2} = \frac{1}{39} \frac{13 \times 2 \times 11}{52 \times 17 \times 25} = \frac{11}{17 \times 25} = \frac{11}{22100} = \frac{1}{1700} = \frac{2}{3400} = \frac{2}{286 \times 39} \times \frac{11}{4} \frac{11}{4 \times 17 \times 25} \frac{11}{17 \times 100} \frac{11}{1700}$$
$\frac{\binom{13}{3}}{\binom{52}{3}} = \frac{\frac{13 \times 12 \times 11}{3 \times 2 \times 1}}{\frac{52 \times 51 \times 50}{3 \times 2 \times 1}} = \frac{13 \times 2 \times 11}{52 \times 17 \times 25} = \frac{286}{22100} = \frac{1}{77} \frac{11}{1700}$.

$\frac{286}{22100} = \frac{143}{11050} = \frac{13\times 11}{52\times 17\times 25} = \frac{11}{17 \times 100} = \frac{1}{78} = \frac{1}{77} \frac{11}{1700}$

Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{11}{850}}$
